section.heading: Navy battle force ship assessment and requirement reporting

subsection.heading: In General.—
subsection.content: Not later than 180 days after the date on which a covered event occurs, the Chief of Naval Operations shall submit to the congressional defense committees a battle force ship assessment and requirement.

subsection.heading: Assessment.—
subsection.chapeau: Each assessment required by subsection (a) shall include the following:

paragraph.content: A review of the strategic guidance of the Federal Government, the Department of Defense, and the Navy for identifying priorities, missions, objectives, and principles, in effect as of the date on which the assessment is submitted, that the force structure of the Navy must follow.
An identification of the steady-state demand for maritime security and security force assistance activities.
An identification of the force options that can satisfy the steady-state demands for activities required by theater campaign plans of combatant commanders.
A force optimization analysis that produces a day-to-day global posture required to accomplish peacetime and steady-state tasks assigned by combatant commanders.
A modeling of the ability of the force to fight and win scenarios approved by the Department of Defense.
A calculation of the number and global posture of each force element required to meet steady-state presence demands and warfighting response timelines.

paragraph.chapeau: Each requirement required by subsection (a) shall—

subparagraph.content: be based on the assessment required by subsection (b); and

subparagraph.chapeau: identify, for each of the fiscal years that are five, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30 years from the date of the covered event—

clause.content: the total number of battle force ships required;
the number of battle force ships required in each of the categories described in paragraph (2);
the classes of battle force ships included in each of the categories described in paragraph (2); and
the number of battle force ships required in each class.

paragraph.chapeau: The categories described in this paragraph are the following:

subparagraph.content: Aircraft carriers.
Large surface combatants.
Small surface combatants.
Amphibious warfare ships.
Attack submarines.
Ballistic missile submarines.
Combat logistics force.
Expeditionary fast transport.
Expeditionary support base.
Command and support.
Other.

subsection.heading: Definitions.—
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

paragraph.chapeau: The term “battle force ship” means the following:

subparagraph.content: A commissioned United States Ship warship capable of contributing to combat operations.
A United States Naval Ship that contributes directly to Navy warfighting or support missions.

paragraph.chapeau: The term “covered event” means a significant change to any of the following:

subparagraph.content: Strategic guidance that results in changes to theater campaign plans or warfighting scenarios.
Strategic laydown of vessels or aircraft that affects sustainable peacetime presence or warfighting response timelines.
Operating concepts, including employment cycles, crewing constructs, or operational tempo limits, that affect peacetime presence or warfighting response timelines.
Assigned missions that affect the type or quantity of force elements.

subsection.heading: Responsibilities of Commandant of Marine Corps.—
subsection.content: In preparing each assessment and requirement under subsection (a), the Commandant of the Marine Corps shall be specifically responsible for developing the requirements relating to amphibious warfare ships and for naval vessels with the primary mission of transporting Marines.

section.heading: Navy shipbuilding workforce development special incentive

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: The Secretary of the Navy shall include in any solicitation for a covered contract a special incentive for workforce development that funds one or more workforce development activities described in subsection (c).

paragraph.heading: Amount of special incentive.—
paragraph.content: The amount of a special incentive required under subsection (a)(1) shall be equal to not less than one quarter of one percent and not more than one percent of the estimated cost of the covered contract.

subparagraph.heading: In general.—
subparagraph.chapeau: The Secretary of the Navy may waive one or more of the requirements of this section if the Secretary determines—

clause.content: unreasonable cost or delay would be incurred by complying with such requirements;
existing workforce development initiatives are sufficient to meet workforce needs;
there are minimal workforce development issues to be addressed; or
it is not in the national security interests of the United States to comply with such requirements.

subparagraph.heading: Notice to congress.—
subparagraph.content: Not less than 30 days prior to issuing a waiver under subparagraph (A), the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees written notice of the intent of the Secretary to issue such a waiver. Such notice shall specify the basis for such waiver and include a detailed explanation of the reasons for issuing the waiver.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.chapeau: Funds for a special incentive for workforce development required under subsection (a)(1) may be expended only—

subparagraph.content: on or after the date on which the service acquisition executive of the Navy receives a written commitment from one or more entities described in paragraph (2) of separate and distinct cumulative monetary contributions to be made on or after the date of such commitment for workforce development; and

in an amount that is equal to the aggregate amount of all monetary contributions from entities that made commitments under subparagraph (A) not to exceed the amount of funding made available for the special incentive under subsection (a)(2).

paragraph.heading: Entities described.—
paragraph.chapeau: The entities described in this paragraph are the following:

subparagraph.content: The prime contractor that was awarded a covered contract.
A qualified subcontractor.
A State government or other State entity.
A county government or other county entity.
A local government or other local entity.
An industry association, organization, or consortium that directly supports workforce development.

paragraph.heading: Special rule.—
paragraph.content: In a case in which the aggregate amount of all monetary contributions from entities that made commitments under paragraph (1)(A) is less than the minimum amount specified for the special incentive under subsection (a)(2), funds for the special incentive may be expended in an amount equal to such lesser amount.

paragraph.heading: In general.—
paragraph.content: Funds for a special incentive for workforce development required under subsection (a)(1) may be obligated or expended only to provide for the activities described in paragraph (2) in support of the production and production support workforce of the prime contractor concerned or a qualified subcontractor concerned.

paragraph.heading: Activities described.—
paragraph.chapeau: The activities described in this paragraph are the following:

subparagraph.content: The creation of short- and long-term workforce housing, transportation, and other support services to facilitate attraction, relocation, and retention of workers.
The expansion of local talent pipeline programs for both new and existing workers.
Investments in long-term outreach in middle school and high school programs, specifically career and technical education programs, to promote and develop manufacturing skills.
The development or modification of facilities for the primary purpose of workforce development.
Payment of direct costs attributable to workforce development.
Attraction and retention bonus programs.
On-the-job training to develop key manufacturing skills.

subsection.heading: Approval Requirement.—
subsection.chapeau: The service acquisition executive of the Navy shall—

paragraph.content: provide the final approval of the use of funds for a special incentive for workforce development required under subsection (a)(1); and

paragraph.chapeau: not later than 30 days after the date on which such approval is provided, certify to the congressional defense committees compliance with the requirements of subsections (b) and (c), including—

subparagraph.content: a detailed explanation of such compliance; and

clause.content: the Federal Government; and
the shipbuilding industrial base of the Navy.

subsection.heading: Definitions.—
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

paragraph.content: The term “covered contract” means a prime contract for the construction of a naval vessel funded using amounts appropriated or otherwise made available for Shipbuilding and Conversion, Navy.
The term “qualified subcontractor” means a subcontractor that will deliver the vessel or vessels awarded under a covered contract to the Navy.

section.heading: Battle force ship employment, maintenance, and manning baseline plans

subsection.heading: In General.—
subsection.chapeau: Not later than 45 days after the date of the delivery of the first ship in a new class of battle force ships, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees a report on the employment, maintenance, and manning baseline plans for the class, including a description of the following:

paragraph.chapeau: The sustainment and maintenance plans for the class that encompass the number of years the class is expected to be in service, including—

subparagraph.content: the allocation of maintenance tasks among organizational, intermediate, depot, or other activities;
the planned duration and interval of maintenance for all depot-level maintenance availabilities; and
the planned duration and interval of drydock maintenance periods.

paragraph.chapeau: Any contractually required integrated logistics support deliverables for the ship, including technical manuals, and an identification of—

subparagraph.content: the deliverables provided to the Government on or before the delivery date; and
the deliverables not provided to the Government on or before the delivery date and the expected dates those deliverables will be provided to the Government.

paragraph.chapeau: The planned maintenance system for the ship, including—

subparagraph.content: the elements of the system, including maintenance requirement cards, completed on or before the delivery date;
the elements of the system not completed on or before the delivery date and the expected completion date of those elements; and
the plans to complete planned maintenance from the delivery date until all elements of the system have been completed.

paragraph.chapeau: The coordinated shipboard allowance list for the class, including—

subparagraph.content: the items on the list onboard on or before the delivery date; and
the items on the list not onboard on or before the delivery date and the expected arrival date of those items.

paragraph.chapeau: The ship manpower document for the class, including—

subparagraph.content: the number of officers by grade and designator; and
the number of enlisted personnel by rate and rating.

paragraph.chapeau: The personnel billets authorized for the ship for the fiscal year in which the ship is delivered and each of the four fiscal years thereafter, including—

subparagraph.content: the number of officers by grade and designator; and
the number of enlisted personnel by rate and rating.

paragraph.chapeau: Programmed funding for manning and end strength on the ship for the fiscal year in which the ship is delivered and each of the four fiscal years thereafter, including—

subparagraph.content: the number of officers by grade and designator; and
the number of enlisted personnel by rate and rating.

paragraph.chapeau: Personnel assigned to the ship on the delivery date, including—

subparagraph.content: the number of officers by grade and designator; and
the number of enlisted personnel by rate and rating.

paragraph.chapeau: For each critical hull, mechanical, electrical, propulsion, and combat system of the class as so designated by the Senior Technical Authority pursuant to section 8669b(c)(2)(C) of this title, the following:

subparagraph.content: The Government-provided training available for personnel assigned to the ship at the time of delivery, including the nature, objectives, duration, and location of the training.
The contractor-provided training available for personnel assigned to the ship at the time of delivery, including the nature, objectives, duration, and location of the training.
Plans to adjust how the training described in subparagraphs (A) and (B) will be provided to personnel after delivery, including the nature and timeline of those adjustments.

paragraph.chapeau: The notional employment schedule of the ship for each month of the fiscal year in which the ship is delivered and each of the four fiscal years thereafter, including an identification of time spent in the following phases:

subparagraph.content: Basic.
Integrated or advanced.
Deployment.
Maintenance.
Sustainment.

subsection.heading: Notification Required.—
subsection.chapeau: Not less than 30 days before implementing a significant change to the baseline plans described in subsection (a) or any subsequent significant change, the Secretary of the Navy shall submit to the congressional defense committees written notification of the change, including for each such change the following:

paragraph.content: An explanation of the change.
The desired outcome.
The rationale.
The duration.
The operational effects.

paragraph.chapeau: The budgetary effects, including—

subparagraph.content: for the year in which the change is made;
over the five years thereafter; and
over the expected service life of the relevant class of battle force ships.

paragraph.chapeau: The personnel effects, including—

subparagraph.content: for the year in which the change is made;
over the five years thereafter; and
over the expected service life of the relevant class of battle force ships.

paragraph.chapeau: The sustainment and maintenance effects, including—

subparagraph.content: for the year in which the change is made;
over the five years thereafter; and
over the expected service life of the relevant class of battle force ships.

paragraph.chapeau: For the purposes of this section, the Secretary of the Navy shall treat as the first ship in a new class of battle force ships the following:

subparagraph.content: U.S.S. John F. Kennedy (CVN–79).
U.S.S. Michael Monsoor (DDG–1001).
U.S.S. Jack H. Lucas (DDG–125).

paragraph.content: For each ship described in paragraph (1), the Senior Technical Authority shall identify critical systems for the purposes of subsection (a)(9).

subsection.heading: Definitions.—
subsection.chapeau: In this section:

paragraph.chapeau: The term “battle force ship” means the following:

subparagraph.content: A commissioned United States Ship warship capable of contributing to combat operations.
A United States Naval Ship that contributes directly to Navy warfighting or support missions.

paragraph.content: The term “delivery” has the meaning provided for in section 8671 of this title.
The term “Senior Technical Authority” has the meaning provided for in section 8669b of this title.
